wikitext.*:
'''plata''' is a [[Telerin]] word meaning "flat of the hand, the hand held upwards or forwards, flat and tensed (with fingers and thumb closed or spread). The significance of this was that it was a common way of saying "there is no weapon in my hand"."<ref>{{VT|47}}, p.8-9</ref>
==Etymology==
It derives from [[Primitive Elvish]] ''[[paláta]]'' [[Sundocarmë|Root]] [[PAL]]
==Cognates==
*[[Quenya]] ''[[palta]]''
==Other versions==
''palata'' appears as is a struck out form of the word in Tolkien's notes.
